active_learning.discussion_prompt: Debate the trade-offs between passive (e.g., TLS fingerprinting, HTTP headers) and active (e.g., Nmap -sV, WhatWeb probes) version detection methods in terms of accuracy, stealth, speed, ethics, and legal implications during reconnaissance.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education on 'Application Version Detection' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > Web 008_Application Security > 002_Information Gathering and Reconnaissance > Active Reconnaissance > Application Version Detection). Use university pedagogy: Bloom's Taxonomy objectives [insert learning_objectives array here], active learning components [discussion, peer teaching, problem-solving], and 4 scaffolding layers [insert scaffolding_layers here]. Incorporate voter consensus: tools (Nmap -sV, WhatWeb, Wappalyzer, Nikto, banner grabbing), techniques (HTTP analysis, fingerprinting), standards (OWASP ASVS for app verification, NIST SP 800-218 SSDF, SBOM), prior knowledge links (port scanning), practical examples (DVWA scans, CVE mapping). Generate 25 high-quality flashcards following this schema [insert flashcard_schema here]. Ensure coverage: 30% REMEMBER/UNDERSTAND, 40% APPLY/ANALYZE, 30% EVALUATE/CREATE; balanced across layers. Distractors must be realistic misconceptions. Embed active learning by including scenario-based cards. Output ONLY in CSV format for Anki import (no headers): Front|Back|Explanation|Bloom_Level|Layer|Tags Example row: What is application version detection?|Process of identifying software versions to uncover known vulnerabilities|**Definition: Ties to vuln mgmt & SBOM**.|REMEMBER|1|foundation,nmap Make explanations concise (1-3 sentences), bold key terms, cite sources (e.g., NIST link).
